stages.title: Define Your Electrical Engineering Vision
stages.description: Clarify your interests in electronics, power systems, or signal processing, and identify target universities.

Global.overview: Top electrical engineering programs value strong math/physics, programming skills, and clear specialization interests. Identify your focus area early.
checklist: Research 5-7 top EE programs (MIT, Stanford, UC Berkeley, Cambridge, ETH Zurich)
Identify specialization (electronics, power systems, signal processing, embedded systems, communications)
Assess your programming and circuit design experience
Create a 3-year roadmap connecting academics, projects, and applications

US.overview: US programs emphasize AP/IB rigor, programming skills, and research. Combine strong academics with practical electronics work.
checklist: Complete AP Physics C (E&M) and AP Calculus BC
Learn programming (Python, C/C++, or MATLAB)
Research reach, target, and safety schools for EE
Identify summer programs (MIT, Stanford, research internships)

UK.overview: UK programs prioritize A-levels, STEP/ENGAA, and strong personal statements. Focus on mathematics and physics.
checklist: Review entry requirements for Cambridge, Imperial, Oxford EE programs
Start STEP or ENGAA preparation
Outline UCAS personal statement connecting math/physics to electronics
Research UK engineering accreditation (IET)

Asia.overview: Bridge national curricula with global standards. Emphasize problem-solving and practical electronics skills.
checklist: Review electromagnetism topics in JEE/IB HL Physics
Learn basic circuit design and simulation
Explore summer programs at top Asian universities
Document interest in specific EE specializations

quiz.q: What skills are most important for electrical engineering?
opts: Math, physics, programming, and circuit design
quiz.correct: Math, physics, programming, and circuit design

stages.title: Build Electronics Projects & Skills
stages.description: Develop hands-on skills through electronics projects, programming, and circuit design.

Global.overview: Demonstrate EE ability through tangible projects. Build circuits, program microcontrollers, and document your work.
checklist: Complete an electronics project (Arduino, Raspberry Pi, or custom circuit)
Learn circuit simulation software (LTspice, Multisim)
Program a microcontroller (Arduino, ESP32, or similar)
Document project with schematics, code, and demonstrations
projectIdeas: Design and build a power supply
Create a digital signal processing project

US.overview: Link projects to competitions, research, and summer programs.
checklist: Submit project to science fair or engineering competition
Apply to EE summer programs or research internships
Create GitHub portfolio showcasing code and projects
Write technical documentation

UK.overview: Integrate projects into EPQ or personal investigations.
checklist: Draft EPQ proposal on electronics topic
Link project to university course modules
Include project in UCAS personal statement
Prepare to discuss projects in interviews

Asia.overview: Use competitions and projects to build portfolios.
checklist: Participate in local electronics competitions
Work with university mentor on project
Document project in English
Connect to global engineering challenges

quiz.q: What's the best way to demonstrate electrical engineering skills?
opts: Build working electronics projects and document them
quiz.correct: Build working electronics projects and document them

stages.title: Strengthen Academic Foundation
stages.description: Excel in mathematics, physics, and programming to demonstrate readiness.

Global.overview: Strong math, physics, and programming preparation is essential.
checklist: Master calculus-based electromagnetism
Complete advanced mathematics (calculus, linear algebra, differential equations)
Learn programming fundamentals (Python, C/C++, or MATLAB)
Maintain strong grades in STEM subjects

US.overview: Prioritize AP courses and programming skills.
checklist: Complete AP Physics C: E&M and AP Calculus BC
Take AP Computer Science A or equivalent
Achieve strong SAT Math or ACT scores
Participate in math/physics competitions

UK.overview: Excel in A-levels and prepare for assessments.
checklist: Achieve A* in A-level Mathematics and Physics
Solve past STEP or ENGAA papers
Consider Further Mathematics A-level
Engage with Isaac Physics challenges

Asia.overview: Integrate with national exams while building international readiness.
checklist: Complete JEE-level electromagnetism and mathematics
Learn programming basics
Maintain strong performance in national exams
Bridge local curriculum to international standards

quiz.q: What academic areas are most critical for electrical engineering?

stages.title: Craft Your Engineering Narrative
stages.description: Translate your technical skills and projects into compelling applications.

Global.overview: Connect your EE passion, projects, and achievements into a cohesive story.
checklist: Write 250-word draft personal statement
Highlight specific electronics projects and impact
Connect engineering to solving real-world problems
Get feedback from mentors

US.overview: Focus on Common App essays and activity descriptions.
checklist: Draft Common App essay with EE focus
Collect strong recommendation letters
Optimize Activities section
Write engineering school supplements

UK.overview: Perfect your UCAS statement and prepare for interviews.
checklist: Complete UCAS personal statement
Include technical reading and projects
Prepare for Oxbridge interviews
Practice explaining projects clearly

Asia.overview: Adapt narrative for multiple university systems.
checklist: Prepare statements for UCAS and Common App
Gather supporting documents
Draft reflection on EE career goals
Translate project documentation

quiz.q: What should your EE personal statement highlight?
opts: Technical passion, electronics projects, and problem-solving
quiz.correct: Technical passion, electronics projects, and problem-solving

stages.title: Final Preparation & Interviews
stages.description: Polish applications and prepare for interviews.

Global.overview: Bring together all your work for confident applications.
checklist: Complete mock interviews with technical focus
Submit all applications
Prepare to discuss projects in detail
Celebrate your engineering journey

US.overview: Rehearse for interviews and finalize applications.
checklist: Conduct mock interview
Submit Common App and supplements
Follow up with recommenders
Prepare portfolio if required
Review STEP/ENGAA-style problems
Practice explaining concepts clearly
Simulate interviews
Finalize UCAS submission
Confirm transcripts and portfolios
Practice interview questions in English
Prepare to discuss projects
Submit final applications

opts: Clear explanation of projects and technical concepts
quiz.correct: Clear explanation of projects and technical concepts
